page.title: 13Fishing on the Eyebrook.
page.content: This reservoir is popular as a trout fishery.Only fly-fishing is permitted but over 20,000 trout are caught each season.Fishing,by permit only ,costs Â£150 per season.Day and evening permits are available and boats hired daily cost Â£6.00 for fishing or bird watching.The perimeter road is restricted in the east to permit holders,as it is considered the environment might suffer if access were uncontrolled.At the fish farm in the S.E.corner are 8 fishponds where trout fry grow before being released into the reservoir.Ponds are protected as herons prey on the fry.Large fish lorries have difficulty in crossing a small bridge over the Eyebrook south of the dam,so are rerouted through Stoke Dry.
